meanings.definition: Capable of being erased or removed.
meanings.sent1: The pencil marks on the paper were effaceable with an eraser.
meanings.sent2: The whiteboard marker left effaceable stains on the board.
meanings.sent3: She tried to make an effaceable doodle on the foggy window.
meanings.sent4: His memory of the event was as effaceable as writing in sand.
meanings.sent5: The snow left an effaceable trail on the pavement.

meanings.definition: Able to be wiped out or obliterated.
meanings.sent1: The graffiti on the wall was effaceable with a good cleaning.
meanings.sent2: The digital file was effaceable from the hard drive.
meanings.sent3: The detective found an effaceable clue that led to the suspect.
meanings.sent4: The old building's history was as effaceable as footprints in the sand.
meanings.sent5: The mistake was so effaceable that no one remembered it the next day.
